query.description: Object that contains the information of a glycan query. Each piece of information in the query is optional however one piece must be present for a meaning full search. In later versions it will be possible to combine query objects using logical operations (AND, OR, NOT).

query_type.description: This fields defines how the different parts/searches of the query are combined. Possible values are AND and OR. The default will be AND.

mass.description: This objects is specified is a search by native glycan mass is performed. The search query consists of a minimum mass (glycan has to have equal or larger mass) and a maximum mass (glycan has to have equal or smaller mass). That way it defines an mass range to be searched.

min.description: Minimum value of the mass range

max.description: Maximum value of the mass range

glycan_type.description: This field is set if a search by glycan type (e.g. N-Glycan) will be performed. The complete list of glycan types is maintained by the glygen server.

glycan_subtype.description: This field is set if a search by glycan subtype (e.g. bisection) will be performed. The complete list of glycan subtypes is maintained by the glygen server. This field can be used intependendly from glycan_type and does not need to be used in combination.

organism.description: This field is set if a search by organism (e.g. human) is performed. The value can either be a scientific species name (NCBI Taxonomy), a synonym or a NCBI Taxonomy ID.

protein.description: This field is set if a search for glycans attached to a protein is performed. The input is a Uniprot protein ID.

glycan_motif.description: This field is set if a search by glycan motif is performed (e.g. LewisX). All structures containing this motif will be found.

glycan_id.description: This field is set if a search by glycan ID is performed. Either an intact ID or part of an ID can be specified. The intact ID will lead to a single result while a partical ID might lead to many results.

enzyme.description: This field is set if a search for glycans synethised by a certain enzyme is performed. The input is an object that consists of an ID and a type.

ID.description: ID of the enzyme this can either be a Uniprot ID (type=protein) or a gene name (type=gene).

type.description: Type of the enzyme input. This can either be a gene or a protein

pagination.description: This object stores the pagenation information for the webpage. By default only a subset of the entire result set is returned to minimize request delay.

offset.description: Start address of subset. This number specifies the first result to be included.

limit.description: Number of results in the subset. For example offset=11 and limit=30 will result in a subset from entry 11 to 40.

total_length.description: Total number of results in the search result list.

sort.description: Sort order of the total result set. Default is ID to sort by glycan ID.

order.description: Sort direction of the total result set. Possible values are asc and desc.

results.description: Object that contains the list of result in this subset. It may not contain the total number of all results depending of the pagination.

id.description: GlyTouCan accession number of the glycan.

mass.description: The mass number of the glycan.

number_monosaccharides.description: The number of sugar in the glycan.

number_glycoproteins.description: The number of glycoproteins that contain the Glycan.

number_enzymes.description: The number of enzymes annonated as involved in the biosynthesis of the glycan.

iupac.description: IUPAC sequence of the glycan. This sequence may not always be present since not all glycans can be represented in IUPAC.

glycoct.description: GlycoCT sequence of the glycan. This sequence may not always be present.
